title: Find the value of a derivative at a point

content.question: Let f be the function given by <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>8</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2.</mn> </mrow> </math> What is the instantaneous rate of change of f at <math> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>?</mo> </mrow> </math>

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
